modules.description: The module offers string case transformation functions such as uppercase, lowercase, camel case, and snake case, along with validation checks to determine if a string adheres to specific casing conventions. It manipulates strings at the character level, supporting index-based customization and flag-driven adjustments for precise control. Use cases include normalizing identifiers, formatting text for readability, or validating input consistency in data processing workflows.

Repeats a string a specified number of times, handling invalid input with an exception. Operates on integers and strings, ensuring valid repetition counts. Used to generate repeated textual patterns in output formatting.

Provides pre-defined strings for digit sets, hexadecimal characters, alphabetic ranges, whitespace, and alphanumeric combinations. Works with string data types to represent standardized character groups. Used in parsing, validation, and string processing tasks requiring specific character sets.

Provides functions to split strings by delimiter, trim whitespace from both ends, and concatenate multiple strings with a separator. Works with standard string types and lists of strings. Used to process CSV data, format log messages, and generate dynamic query parameters.

Transforms and manipulates strings through case conversion, repetition, and character set handling. It supports operations like uppercase, lowercase, camel case, snake case, string duplication, and access to predefined character groups. Functions enable tasks such as normalizing identifiers, generating repeated patterns, and validating character composition. Examples include converting user input to a consistent format, creating formatted output with repeated segments, and filtering strings based on defined character ranges.
